body_html:
@apaszke in theory it's pretty straightforward.

You'll need onnx installed. It needs some dependencies (protobuf and a few python libraries like numpy which you probably already have), and then simply run setup.py build develop.

You'll also need caffe2, which again is some deps and then setup_caffe2.py build develop from the top level of the pytorch repo. Actually this failure happens before any caffe2 functionality is used, so at your option you could also hack around it by just commenting out the caffe2 import in the test_caffe2.py file.

And the test itself is found in the onnx-fb-universe repo - no need to install, just download and run the test.

If those installations end up being super frustrating for whatever reason, either message me to help with the installations or i could potentially just figure out the fix for this bug myself.

Actually this failure happens before any caffe2 functionality is used, so at your option you could also hack around it by just commenting out the caffe2 import in the test_caffe2.py file.
And the test itself is found in the onnx-fb-universe repo - no need to install, just download and run the test.

body:
@apaszke in theory it's pretty straightforward. 

You'll need onnx installed. It needs some dependencies (protobuf and a few python libraries like numpy which you probably already have), and then simply run `setup.py build develop`.

You'll also need caffe2, which again is some deps and then `setup_caffe2.py build develop` from the top level of the pytorch repo. Actually this failure happens before any caffe2 functionality is used, so at your option you could also hack around it by just commenting out the caffe2 import in the test_caffe2.py file.

And the test itself is found in the onnx-fb-universe repo - no need to install, just download and run the test.

If those installations end up being super frustrating for whatever reason, either message me to help with the installations or i could potentially just figure out the fix for this bug myself.
